TimeML.TITLE: 5 Best Dog Breeds for Families
TimeML.TEXT:
Family Dog 2
Every family who chooses which kind of dog breed for their family must keep this in mind. Every dog is loyal to their master and the dogs attitude is developed by how the master had treated them. It is also important to consider the dogs activeness and physical activity needs.
Here are the 5 best dog breeds for families:
1.) Bulldog
Other than the aggressive bulldogs face, this dog breed very less aggression. They are not very energetic and does not react negatively on situations. Considering the traits of this dog breed, this is very ideal for families.
Bulldog
Bulldog with Kid
2.) Beagle
Beagles are energetic and friendly. This is ideal for families with children who loves to play a lot in their backyards. The dog is a bit of high maintenance when it comes to brushing and bathing but is worth spending some money for how they interact with people.
Beagle
Beagle with Kid
3.) Bull Terrier
Bull terriers are intelligent, energetic and friendly dogs that can take a lot of roughhousing while remaining calm. Particularly suited to large families, they dont complain too much when manhandled by children, and can actually help teach kids how to properly relate to dogs.
Bull Terrier
Bull Terrier with Kids
4.) Collie
Collies love nothing more than to make their humans happy, and its really not a stretch to imagine that you could train a dog in fetching some things for you. Collie is a bit high maintenance and on it grooming considering it long coat.
Collie
Collie with Kid
5.) Newfoundland
The Newfoundland has been dubbed Natures Nannies. As the words explained, they naturally love children and are very friendly in general. This type of dog breed is huge in size, but has a heart as soft as a kid.
Newfoundland
Newfoundland with Kid
